models.name: discussion_board_guests
models.description: Guest actor entity representing unauthenticated visitors of the discussion board system. Used for tracking browsing or search activity and potential auditing. Guests do not have login credentials, and do not author topics or replies. This table facilitates tracking session history, device fingerprinting, or future personalization without registration.

plainFields.name: anonymous_token
plainFields.description: Randomly generated anonymous token for tracking session or device activity. Used for distinguishing unique guest sessions without revealing personal data.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the guest record is first created. Used for session and analytics tracking.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for the last update of the guest record (e.g., session refresh).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for soft-deletion of the guest record, if applicable. Null when active.

models.name: discussion_board_members
models.description: Registered user (member) entity representing authenticated users of the discussion board. Members have login credentials, author topics and replies, and can be uniquely identified by email and username. This entity stores hashed password for authentication, and supports full audit and soft-delete tracking for compliance.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Unique business email address for member login and communication. Must be verified via registration process.

plainFields.name: username
plainFields.description: Display name chosen by member, used in topics and replies. Must be unique for identity within the discussion board.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Hashed password for secure login authentication. Never stored in plain text. Required for authentication process.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Indicates whether the member's email address has been verified via confirmation link.

plainFields.name: registration_completed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the member's registration was fully completed and email verified. Used for audit and onboarding analytics.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the member record is first created. Used for traceability and analytics.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for the last update of the member record (e.g., profile or password change).

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for soft-deletion of the member account. Null when active.

models.name: discussion_board_admins
models.description: Administrator entity representing privileged users with management rights over the discussion board system. Admins require authentication and are granted system-level permissions such as user management and, if enabled, moderation. Designed as a standalone entity (not a member subtype) per business directive, supporting distinct audit trails and privilege separation.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description: Unique email address for administrator login and communication. Must be business-verified as part of privileged account control.

plainFields.name: username
plainFields.description: Display name selected by admin, used for identifying admin actions and events.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description: Securely hashed password for administrator authentication. Never stored as plain text.

plainFields.name: email_verified
plainFields.description: Indicates whether the admin's email has been verified via a confirmation workflow.

plainFields.name: registration_completed_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the admin account has successfully completed verification and is enabled for privileged access.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for account creation, establishing audit trail for admin onboarding.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for the most recent administrative account update, such as profile changes or security resets.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for soft-deletion (optional) of the admin account, null for active admins.

models.name: discussion_board_topics
models.description: Discussion board topics representing main discussion threads for economic and political conversations. Each topic is authored by a member or admin and contains a subject/title, content/body, and timestamps for auditing. Supports many topics per member/admin. Links to discussion_board_members or discussion_board_admins (via author foreign key), enforcing that only authenticated users can create topics. Forms the primary entity for all board discussions, supporting full CRUD and search capabilities. Related entity: {@link discussion_board_replies} for topic replies.

foreignFields.name: author_member_id
foreignFields.description: Author's {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Used when the author is a standard member. One and only one of author_member_id or author_admin_id must be set.

foreignFields.name: author_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Author's {@link discussion_board_admins.id}. Used when the author is an admin. One and only one of author_member_id or author_admin_id must be set.

plainFields.name: subject
plainFields.description: Subject or title of the discussion topic. Minimum 5, maximum 120 characters, required.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Main body/content of the topic. Minimum 10, maximum 4000 characters, required.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the topic was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the topic was last edited or updated.

models.name: discussion_board_replies
models.description: Replies to discussion board topics, representing user-generated contributions to threads. Each reply must reference its parent topic ({@link discussion_board_topics}), link to an author (member or admin), and include reply content and timestamps. Many replies per topic, many replies per author. Designed for independent retrieval: enables finding all replies by user or by topic. Essential for interaction between users in the discussion board. No moderation, voting, or extra metadata included at this phase.

foreignFields.name: topic_id
foreignFields.description: The topic that this reply is attached to. References {@link discussion_board_topics.id}. Every reply must belong to a valid topic.

foreignFields.name: author_member_id
foreignFields.description: Reply author's {@link discussion_board_members.id}. Used when reply is by a member. One and only one of author_member_id or author_admin_id must be set.

foreignFields.name: author_admin_id
foreignFields.description: Reply author's {@link discussion_board_admins.id}. Used when reply is by an admin. One and only one of author_member_id or author_admin_id must be set.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Content/body of the reply. Minimum 3, maximum 2000 characters, required.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the reply was created.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the reply was last edited or updated.
